data.title: Microsoft Kicks Off Next-Gen Cycle With Xbox Series X and Series S Launch
data.text: The tech titan is delivering a different kind of next-gen.

data.title: Microsoft Says Demand Incredibly High for New Xbox X, S
data.text: Nov.10 -- Phil Spencer, executive vice president of gaming at Microsoft Corp., discusses demand for the new Xbox Series X and S, and building consoles during the Covid-19 pandemic. He speaks with Emily Chang on "Bloomberg Technology.

data.title: Get Ready For The Launch With Microsoft
data.text: The new Xbox is about to see its global debut. Microsoft has had a great half with many business lines seeing extra growth.

data.title: Microsoft and the Open Data Institute announce an Education Open Data Challenge to help close the digital divide
data.text: LONDON and REDMOND, Wash., Nov. 10, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- Microsoft and the Open Data Institute (ODI) announced today the launch of an Education Open Data Challenge to shine light on the relationship between broadband access and K-12 (ages 5 to 18 years old) education outcomes. In the wake...

data.title: Microsoft and OpenAI propose automating U.S. tech export controls
data.text: Microsoft and OpenAI propose using 'digital' approaches to previously manual means of controlling U.S. technology exports.

data.title: Xbox Series X Launch: 3 Key Takeaways for Microsoft Stock Investors
data.text: Microsoft is kicking off the gaming console wars through the Xbox Series X launch today. Here is what it could mean for MSFT stock.

data.title: Microsoft stock price slips lower as Xbox Series X and Xbox Series S are launched
data.text: Microsoft Corp. (NASDAQ: MSFT) launched its two new models of Xbox today in an effort to cash in on the current gaming boom as many are still stuck at home due to the second wave of coronavirus.  Fundamental analysis: The console race heats up The new Xbox Series X, which Microsoft calls the most powerful console in the world, will be priced at $499.99, while the cheaper version Xbox Series S will retail at $299.99.

data.title: These are the 9 'dictionary' stocks investors should hold onto as the reopening trade stages a comeback, Fundstrat says
data.text: Throughout the COVID-19 pandemic, Fundstrat's Tom Lee has advised clients to buy the "epicenter" stocks in anticipation of a successful vaccine being developed. "Epicenter" stocks are those that were most harmed by the onset of the pandemic and are now set to benefit from the reopening of the economy. These include airlines, casinos, restaurants and so on.

data.title: 5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Buy on Coronavirus Vaccine Hope
data.text: A COVID-19 vaccine likely to benefit the Dow the most as it is more inclined toward cyclical stocks. Five among these are NIKE (NKE), Dow (DOW), The Procter & Gamble (PG), 3M (MMM) and Microsoft (MSFT).

data.title: Microsoft launches next-generation Xbox gaming consoles amid pandemic-driven demand
data.text: Microsoft Corp on Tuesday launched two models of its Xbox gaming console, seven years after the debut of the previous version, to capture a pandemic-driven boom in consumer spending on games.
